node.title: 'We can almost hear the grass growing': Outback NT gets a drenching
node.alt: a dark, cloudy sky with a bogged truck on the side of the road
node.description: Some stations surpass their highest daily November rainfall, coming as a welcome relief for many after the Territory's third-warmest October on record.
node.content:
["Residents across the Northern Territory are celebrating days of heavy rainfall, with more forecast for the week ahead.", "The wet weather is a welcome relief for many after the Territory's third-warmest October on record.", "The Bureau of Meteorology\u00a0issued severe thunderstorm warnings throughout the week, as some stations recorded their highest daily November rainfall on record.\u00a0", "Up to 50 millimetres\u00a0is forecast across most of the Territory over the coming week.", "", "
After a night of rain, waterfalls cascaded off Uluru this week.(Supplied: Jessica Head)
", "Curtain Springs Station, 100 kilometres east of Uluru, received more than 50mm of rain this week \u2014 more than twice its average November total.", "\"It's been perfect rainfall for us, not only in the amount but how it's fallen,\" the station's Lindy Severin said.", "\"We could not have asked for it to be any better.\"", "", "
Curtain Springs received around 50mm this week.(Facebook: Curtain Springs Station)
", "From the Lasseter district to the Barkly Tablelands and western Top End, rainfall was widespread across the Territory.\u00a0", "Hugh Dawson from Beetaloo Station in the Barkly\u00a0said the property recorded more than 50mm.", "\"I think those early showers are certainly very promising for us,\" Mr Dawson said.", "\"Hopefully it keeps coming. It'd be great to see this keep building into a good, normal wet season.\"", "While it is\u00a0welcome relief to many, the rain can cause delays for mango farms.", "Mango growers avoid picking during wet weather to prevent the spread of fungal diseases that can cause fruit to spoil.\u00a0", "\"After 25mm of rain, we pull up \u2014\u00a0there's a threat of the mangoes contracting anthracnose, which is a fungal disease,\" Nutrano packing shed manager Paul Cox said.", "\"So we let the trees dry out for 24 hours and then we start picking and packing again.\"", "Mr Cox said they\u00a0had two days off over the past few weeks.", "\"And there's more [rain]\u00a0expected next week too, so potentially we could have another couple of days off.\"\u00a0"]
